channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Between 1 3 5 Beechurst Avenue, 19th January
item.description:
Very bad repair by Gloucestershire Highways area sunk and cracked, my mother inlaw fell yesterday due to the pavement being uneven.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Beechurst Avenue, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Potholes, debris and Glass, 19th January
item.description:
The road is generally in bad state. The parking spots have glass and debris everywhere also the grass verge is covering the curbs could be dangerous as there is no indication where the curb is. If the road and green area where kept up to standards I believe the residents would respect the area more
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42;43, St Peter's Square, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Amber light not working on traffic light, 19th January
item.description:
Crossing across Sandford Road between the chapel & Boyne House at Cheltenham College. Thank you. The issue was reported to us around 15 minutes ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandford Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Multiple briken and rocky pavement slabs, 19th January
item.description:
2 and 4 cowley close driveway access. Multiple damaged slabs. Some rocking or trip hazard. 2nd time reported broken. Replaced 2023

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Cowley Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged x2 drain covers, iron sticking out, large hole, very dangerous to cyclists and other road users, 19th January
item.description:
Damaged x2 drain covers, iron sticking out, large hole, very dangerous to cyclists, had to avoid as I would of fallen off. Near hit from a passing car as the road is already to narrow. I cannot believe this has been left life this for 6 weeks and still not sorted. This hole is on the left after the bridge, before Windyridge turning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 404, Swindon Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repaired potholes need quality checks, 19th January
item.description:
These 2 potholes in Mendip Close, 1 outside No7, the other outside No 14 were 'repaired' this week late in the evening by 2 operatives with headtorches!. The holes can only be described as 'temporary fixes', in that the tarmac used was obviously left over from a previous job, has not been compacted correctly, and is now being damaged by normal residential traffic. The repairs will not last long in this weather as water will ingress then freeze, and I fully expect to have to report them again very soon. Please inspect and appoint the contractors to re-do the job properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Mendip Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway is in extremely bad condition, 19th January
item.description:
The pathway is extremely uneven and shocking condition and the kerbstones are always loose, the kerbstones get fixed every year when they get reported and to be honest i could do a better job with no experience, they last about 5 minutes. Everybody walks on the road because the paths are so uneven and dangerous all the way down to the garages. There are a lot of elderly people down this road as well and they cannot walk on the paths so they walk in the road. I have lived down this road for 20 years and it has never been resolved 'properly'. I now live down the bottom by the garages (to the right, and this is in the worse condition) and the road surface is also deteriorating because of all the cars coming down and turning in the same area (in front of my house), so this tarmac could also be fixed in certain areas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horsbere Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 19th January
item.description:
report potholes on the above road
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New manhole cover on repaired section of road is loose and ‘clunks’ when driven over which is frequently as busy road. Disturbs sleep!, 19th January
item.description:
Loose/noisy/rattling manhole cover is located on the road outside 285 Gloucester Road (Dalkeith Nursing Home) to the left of the bus stop. The road is busy and so the noise is extremely frequent and is disturbing our sleep. It would be wonderful to have the manhole cover fitted securely. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 332, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Norfolk Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 19th January
item.description:
Customer reported that traffic light pole on RHS filter lane if you were driving on the A40 from Oxford to Cheltenham, has been twisted around by approx 45 degrees. Now, when the green light shows, it appears to be signalling to motorists on A436 coming from Stow. Customer drives this route 2 x a day and knows that the traffic light is facing the wrong way. Very concerned that it will cause an accident by signalling motorists from A436 across A40. Traffic light is located on an island by itself.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Substandard materials & workmanship, 19th January
item.description:
Breakup of newly repaired foot path. The sub standard materials used are breaking up from foot traffic & creating a mess on the path & into my garden, the area was not painted with liquid tar before installation of the fine macadam, which was cold applied so has not consolidated as it should, the resalt is the job needs to done again at additional cost !.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Warden Hill Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
